passages.title: Frankenstein, by Mary Wollstonecraft (Godwin) Shelley
passages.text: I cannot describe to you my sensations on the near prospect of my undertaking. It is impossible to communicate to you a conception of the trembling sensation, half pleasurable and half fearful, with which I am preparing to depart.

passages.title: Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen
passages.text: Mr. Bennet was among the earliest of those who waited on Mr. Bingley. He had always intended to visit him, though to the last always assuring his wife that he should not go; and till the evening after the visit was paid she had no knowledge of it.
